title: Blockquote - Usage Examples
description: Common usage patterns and example configurations for typographic quotations

examples.name: Simple Testimonial (Style 1)
examples.description: Clean blockquote with centered alignment for customer testimonials
examples.visualDescription: Simple quote text with author name below, centered alignment, subtle gray text, clean typography

attributes.content: You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future.

examples.useCase: Customer testimonials, reviews, simple quotes on landing pages

examples.name: Classic Quote with Large Icon (Style 2)
examples.description: Traditional blockquote with large decorative quote mark icon
examples.visualDescription: Large purple quote icon in top-left, quote text indented, author attribution in smaller italic text, elegant serif typography

attributes.content: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle.

examples.useCase: Blog articles, editorial content, magazine-style quotes, thought leadership pieces

examples.name: Featured Quote with Gradient Background

examples.visualDescription: Purple-to-blue gradient background, white text, centered alignment, elevated with shadow, rounded corners, high-impact design

attributes.content: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower. Think different, think ahead.

examples.useCase: Hero sections, featured testimonials, call-out quotes, keynote presentations

examples.name: Book Review Quote with Attribution
examples.description: Detailed quote with custom author typography for book reviews or citations
examples.visualDescription: Left-aligned quote, serif font for body, sans-serif for author, distinct typography hierarchy, academic/editorial style

attributes.content: This book changed the way I think about design and simplicity. Every page offers profound insights into creating products people love. A must-read for anyone in tech.

examples.useCase: Book reviews, editorial testimonials, professional endorsements, case study quotes

examples.name: Pull Quote with Left Border Accent
examples.description: Minimalist quote with bold left border accent for in-article pull quotes
examples.visualDescription: Thick purple left border (5px), left-aligned text, increased font size, subtle background, magazine pull-quote style

attributes.content: Great design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Great design is how it works.

examples.useCase: Blog pull quotes, in-article highlights, content emphasis, sidebar callouts

examples.name: Interactive Quote with Hover Effects
examples.description: Dynamic blockquote with color changes and shadow elevation on hover
examples.visualDescription: Starts gray with subtle shadow, on hover transforms to purple gradient with elevated shadow, smooth transitions, engaging interaction

attributes.content: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work.

examples.useCase: Interactive testimonial grids, clickable quote cards, portfolio reviews, service highlights

examples.name: Minimal Centered Hero Quote
examples.description: Large, minimal quote for hero sections with maximum visual impact
examples.visualDescription: Extra-large font (32px), centered, no author, no background, pure typography, high-contrast, minimal padding

examples.description: Premium styled quote with all advanced features for maximum visual impact
examples.visualDescription: Large quote icon (80px), gradient background, white text, rounded corners, elevated shadow, author attribution, complete styling

attributes.content: This product revolutionized our workflow. The attention to detail, intuitive design, and powerful features make it the best tool in its category. We've seen 300% productivity gains.
attributes.authorName: â€” Sarah Johnson, VP Product at TechCorp

examples.useCase: Award testimonials, featured client reviews, case study highlights, success story quotes, premium landing pages

validationRules.block_id: Required - Unique identifier for the block
validationRules.style: Required - Must be 'style-1' (simple) or 'style-2' (with quote icon)
validationRules.content: Required - The quote text content (HTML allowed)
validationRules.authorName: Optional - Author attribution (can be empty for anonymous quotes)
validationRules.qiconSize: Style-2 only - Icon size, recommended 50-100px for visibility
validationRules.iconLoffset: Style-2 only - Horizontal position of quote icon
validationRules.iconToffset: Style-2 only - Vertical position of quote icon
validationRules.quoteColor: Style-2 only - Color of the quote icon
validationRules.authorTypo: Style-2 only - Typography settings for author attribution
validationRules.typography.openTypography: Must be 1 to enable typography settings
validationRules.boxPadding: Responsive padding - use larger left padding for style-2 to accommodate quote icon

warnings: âš ï¸ Style-2 specific attributes (quoteIcon, qiconSize, authorTypo, etc.) only work when style='style-2'
âš ï¸ For style-2, ensure left padding (boxPadding.left) is large enough (100-140px) to accommodate the quote icon
âš ï¸ Quote icon requires FontAwesome to be loaded (check theme/plugin dependencies)
âš ï¸ HTML content in 'content' attribute is allowed but must be properly escaped
âš ï¸ Author name can be empty - useful for anonymous quotes or when attribution is unnecessary
âš ï¸ Quote icon positioning (iconLoffset, iconToffset) is absolute - test on all breakpoints
âš ï¸ Gradient backgrounds require bgType='gradient' and properly structured gradientColor array
âš ï¸ Hover effects (catBgHover, catBoxShadowHover, textHoverColor) require both normal and hover states for smooth transitions
âš ï¸ Large shadow blur values (>30px) may impact performance on mobile devices
âš ï¸ contentAlignment affects both quote text and author name alignment
âš ï¸ Typography settings require openTypography=1 to take effect
âš ï¸ Border radius changes on hover (HvrborderRadius) may cause visual jumps - use subtle differences
commonMistakes: âŒ Using style-2 attributes with style='style-1' (they won't render)
âŒ Setting openTypography=0 while configuring font sizes (typography won't apply)
âŒ Insufficient left padding on style-2 causing quote icon to overlap text
âŒ Forgetting to set quoteIcon when using style-2 (no icon will appear)
âŒ Using px units for responsive typography (prefer rem/em for better scaling)
âŒ Not testing quote icon position on mobile breakpoints (may need adjustment)
âŒ Applying authorTypo settings to style-1 (only works on style-2)
âŒ Using very long quotes without adequate line-height (reduces readability)
âŒ Setting gradient with only one color (need at least 2 colors with different positions)
âŒ Not setting bgType='gradient' when using bgGradient object (will default to color)
âŒ Enabling hover effects without normal states (causes abrupt transitions)
âŒ Using dark text on dark backgrounds (check color contrast for accessibility)
âŒ Forgetting unit property in responsive objects (defaults may not match intention)
âŒ Setting openShadow=0 while configuring shadow properties (shadow won't render)
âŒ Using identical normal and hover states (defeats purpose of interactivity)
bestPractices: âœ… Use style-1 for simple, clean quotes; style-2 for editorial/classic blockquotes
âœ… Keep quote length under 3-4 sentences for better readability
âœ… Use semantic HTML in content (e.g., <em> for emphasis, <strong> for important text)
âœ… Provide author attribution for credibility unless anonymity is required
âœ… Match quote typography to your site's overall design system
âœ… Use responsive font sizes (md/sm/xs) to ensure readability on all devices
âœ… Apply subtle hover effects to make quotes feel interactive (but not distracting)
âœ… Use contrasting colors for quote icon vs background in style-2
âœ… Maintain adequate padding to prevent text from touching container edges
âœ… Use box shadows sparingly - subtle shadows (blur: 10-20px) often look better
âœ… Test gradient backgrounds with white and dark text to ensure readability
âœ… Use left border accent (borderNormal left-only) for minimal pull-quote style
âœ… Center-align short, impactful quotes; left-align longer testimonials
âœ… Use italic fontStyle for authorTypo to differentiate from quote text
âœ… For hero sections, use large typography (32-48px) with minimal styling
âœ… Apply consistent border radius values (same on all corners) for clean look
âœ… Use rgba colors for subtle overlays and shadow effects
âœ… Set lineHeight to 1.5-1.8em for comfortable reading
âœ… For pull quotes in articles, use bold fontWeight (600-700) to stand out
âœ… Keep quote icon size proportional to text size (icon ~2-3x larger than text)

style-1.bestFor: Testimonials, customer reviews, clean minimal quotes

style-2.description: Classic blockquote with large decorative quote icon
style-2.bestFor: Editorial content, magazine-style quotes, thought leadership, book reviews
style-2.requiredSetup: Ensure left padding is 100-140px to accommodate quote icon

responsivePatterns: ğŸ“± Reduce font sizes on mobile: md:20px â†’ sm:18px â†’ xs:16px
ğŸ“± Decrease quote icon size on smaller screens: md:80px â†’ sm:60px â†’ xs:50px
ğŸ“± Reduce left padding on mobile for style-2: md:140px â†’ sm:110px â†’ xs:90px
ğŸ“± Adjust boxPadding proportionally across breakpoints
ğŸ“± Test quote icon position (iconLoffset, iconToffset) on all breakpoints
ğŸ“± Consider reducing line-height slightly on mobile to save vertical space
ğŸ“± Simplify hover effects on touch devices (they may not trigger properly)
accessibilityNotes: â™¿ Use semantic <blockquote> HTML in content for screen readers
â™¿ Ensure color contrast ratio of 4.5:1 minimum for text (WCAG AA)
â™¿ Author attribution should be marked up with <cite> tag when possible
â™¿ Avoid using color alone to convey meaning (e.g., use both color and icon)
â™¿ Ensure hover effects don't convey critical information (not accessible on touch)
â™¿ Test with screen readers to verify proper quote attribution announcement
â™¿ Large text (18px+) requires only 3:1 contrast ratio (WCAG AA Large Text)
â™¿ Quote icons are decorative - ensure they use aria-hidden if rendered as images
performanceConsiderations: âš¡ Avoid very large shadow blur values (>40px) on mobile - impacts paint performance
âš¡ Use solid colors instead of gradients when possible for better rendering
âš¡ Gradient backgrounds are GPU-accelerated but still heavier than solid colors
âš¡ Hover effects with multiple property changes may cause repaints - keep minimal
âš¡ FontAwesome icons add ~100KB to page load if not already included
âš¡ Border radius with large values can impact rendering on older devices
âš¡ Use will-change: transform on hover effects for smoother transitions (CSS)
âš¡ Limit number of blockquotes with complex styling on a single page (<5 recommended)
integrationPatterns: ğŸ”— Use within testimonial carousels (tp-anything-carousel) for rotating customer quotes
ğŸ”— Combine with tp-container for full-width quote sections
ğŸ”— Place in tp-column for side-by-side testimonial comparisons
ğŸ”— Use isRptBlock=true when inside tp-repeater-block for ACF-powered quotes
ğŸ”— Integrate with dynamic content via usesContext for post-specific quotes
ğŸ”— Pair with tp-heading above for section titles ('What Our Customers Say')
ğŸ”— Use in tp-accordion-inner for expandable FAQ quotes
ğŸ”— Combine multiple blockquotes in a grid layout for testimonial pages
